java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so: /home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so: wrong ELF class: ELFCLASS64

*** Bug 142706 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Works for me.  I suppose you are running on a 64bits machine. I tested here using an AMD64 running RedHat Linux 8.

I googled the web and it seems you can get this error by running 32bits library on a 64bits machine.
what is the output of the command:
file /home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so

my output is:
libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so: ELF 64-bit LSB shared object, AMD x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), stripped
Have you try a newer version of Eclipse, i.e. Eclipse 3.2 Rc4 ?

Ok,
  after several hours of searches in the web, I've discovered that in my case it was a simple rights problem. In particular, running eclipse as "root" user there were no problems; then it was straightforward it could have been a permission problem. Finally I have discovered that mounting the user's home in fstab with "exec" parameter solves the problem.

  That's all.

I have a 64bits libary:

/home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so:
ELF 64-bit LSB shared object, AMD x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), stripped

I also get the error if I run eclipse as root.

Now I will download the newest version and test it...

DJ: this is similar to Bug 142748, here the problem seems to be file permissions.


CiAn: Thanks for the research.
I tried Eclipse 3.2 RC4 but it also didn't run. I got the same error message.

Max, what is the output of
ls -l /home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so

Try to change the permissions of the file
chmod 775 /home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so

Let me if that helps.

The output of:
ls -l /home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so

Is:
-rw-r--r-- 1 max users 358896 19. Mai 23:35 /home/max/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/85/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so

I did the chmod to the file and the to .eclipse:
chmod 775 -R .eclipse/

but it didn't solve the problem.

I installed a new version of my system and now everything works fine.

Thanks for all.
